newsitem.title: SPAIN: GOLF-LANGER HAS CHANCE OF EXTENDING RECORD.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-LANGER HAS CHANCE OF EXTENDING RECORD.

text.p: Bernhard Langer gave himself the chance of extending one of golf's most illustrious records when he fired a two-under-par 69 in the Volvo Masters second round on Friday.
The German has won at least one full European Tour event every year for 16 seasons -- but not in 1996.
The Volvo Masters represents his last attempt at stretching his run.
Langer captured the title here in 1994 when he also set the nine-under-par course record of 62 but he has not shown the form lately to suggest any achievements of that calibre.
He came into the tournament with sore shoulders and a sore finger, plus the putting problems that have bedevilled him for several months. He is now using a long-handled putter.
His 69 following an opening 73 left him level par and well within striking distance of the pacesetters.
"My shoulders feel much better and I played well today," he said. "I hit a lot of irons close and with a bit of luck it could have been a good round.
"I'm working hard on it but I wish I could have done two or three better because it was on for me to do so.
"I'm still not making enough putts to be at the top of the leader board.
"But at least I'm giving myself chances and that's fun."
He said his worst miss was from nine feet at the first hole, "but I'm not making enough in the 10-15 foot range".
He did sink putts of 15 feet at the 10th and 12 feet at the third and he made a good par-saving putt of 15 feet at the watery 17th.
His second shot with a five-wood was right at the pin but it hit the slope and rolled back into the water.
"That green is tough and not even the third shot if you play safe is easy," Langer said.
